Review_title: I Got The Irish In Me
Review_Text: This was a bit of fun. My only complaint is that they overdid the immigration aspect of the story. Their personal feelings about it were fine; it was just that the emphasis on the history of it, readily available elsewhere, took over the second part of the movie to a degree. As a result, it diluted some of the "will they do it?" excitement. With the right directior and editor, this could have been a nailbaiting one hour special!

I have some Irish blood and I loved The is My Home. Dave Browne and Dave Rooney are two musicians who live in Vegas. They travel to every state in America to play a gig and set a Guinness Book of World Records. Along the way(14,000 miles) and a shortage of cash, the pair struggle to finish their dream. It is a tour of the American landscape with a good deal of drinking and laughter. Immigration is a major theme and sometimes we need to be reminded that our ancestors came here for a better life. One of the best films of the year.

I was finally able to sit down and watch this film. I have been wanting to see it since before it was finished. Dave and Dave I am proud to be able to call you friends. It was even better than expected. Hope to get to see you in person again when the world returns to normal. Slaint√©!
